TopicTitle: Transfering craft files from SPH to VAB and opposite

Articles.Content:
Is it possible to do this and make the symmetry act normal instead of staying as what it was in the previous building?

I've built a rover in the SPH that I plan to land on Duna, and after moving the file to the VAB file, (NOTE: I HAVE changed the SPH line in the file to VAB) the symmetry acts like it would in the SPH. If I try to add side-mounted objects, one will be right and the other will be upside-down.

Any way to get it to work correctly?

Edited July 30, 2013 by NuclearWarfare
Thread got pushed to the third page. Can anybody help?
After you get it in the VAB, have you tried replacing the command pod?

Try the incredibly useful Editor Extension Mod (an updated remake of Deadbeefs EdTools). With this mod for the VAB/SPH, you can toggle between "Mirror Symmetry + Runway Launch" and "Radial Symmetry + Launchpad launch" by pressing "Tab". You also get more options for radial symmetry and snap angles, and a "vertical snap" option.
I'm sure one of these will work, so I'll mark this as answered. Thanks!

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/38285-0-20-x-Subassembly-Manager Try saving it with the subassembly manager and then spawning it in the VAB. Nevermind

Edited July 31, 2013 by RankWinner
